issues.title: Unprotected initializer
issues.description: Consider protecting the initializer functions with modifiers.

issues.title: Unsafe Casting of integers
issues.description: Downcasting int/uints in Solidity can be unsafe due to the potential for data loss and unintended behavior.When downcasting a larger integer type to a smaller one (e.g., uint256 to uint128), the value may exceed the range of the target type,leading to truncation and loss of significant digits. Use OpenZeppelin's SafeCast library to safely downcast integers.

issues.title: Incorrect Assembly Shift Parameter Order
issues.description: Example: `shl(shifted, 4)` will shift the right constant `4` by `a` bits. The correct order is `shl(4, shifted)`.

issues.title: Incorrect use of caret operator
issues.description: The caret operator is usually mistakenly thought of as an exponentiation operator but actually, it's a bitwise xor operator.

issues.title: Yul block contains `return`
issues.description: This causes the transaction execution to halt, and nothing after that call will execute including code following the assembly block.

issues.title: `delegatecall` to an Arbitrary Address
issues.description: Making a `delegatecall` to an arbitrary address without any checks is dangerous. Consider adding requirements on the target address.

issues.title: Contract locks Ether without a withdraw function
issues.description: It appears that the contract includes a payable function to accept Ether but lacks a corresponding function to withdraw it, which leads to the Ether being locked in the contract. To resolve this issue, please implement a public or external function that allows for the withdrawal of Ether from the contract.

issues.title: Centralization Risk
issues.description: Contracts have owners with privileged rights to perform admin tasks and need to be trusted to not perform malicious updates or drain funds.

issues.title: Unsafe ERC20 Operation
issues.description: ERC20 functions may not behave as expected. For example: return values are not always meaningful. It is recommended to use OpenZeppelin's SafeERC20 library.

issues.title: Unspecific Solidity Pragma
issues.description: Consider using a specific version of Solidity in your contracts instead of a wide version. For example, instead of `pragma solidity ^0.8.0;`, use `pragma solidity 0.8.0;`

issues.title: Address State Variable Set Without Checks
issues.description: Check for `address(0)` when assigning values to address state variables.

issues.title: Public Function Not Used Internally
issues.description: If a function is marked public but is not used internally, consider marking it as `external`.

issues.title: Literal Instead of Constant
issues.description: Define and use `constant` variables instead of using literals. If the same constant literal value is used multiple times, create a constant state variable and reference it throughout the contract.

issues.title: Empty `require()` / `revert()` Statement
issues.description: Use descriptive reason strings or custom errors for revert paths.

issues.title: Empty Block
issues.description: Consider removing empty blocks.

issues.title: Large Numeric Literal
issues.description: Large literal values multiples of 10000 can be replaced with scientific notation.Use `e` notation, for example: `1e18`, instead of its full numeric value.

issues.title: Internal Function Used Only Once
issues.description: Instead of separating the logic into a separate function, consider inlining the logic into the calling function. This can reduce the number of function calls and improve readability.

issues.title: Contract has TODO Comments
issues.description: Contract contains comments with TODOS. Consider implementing or removing them.

issues.title: Unused Error
issues.description: Consider using or removing the unused error.

issues.title: Loop Contains `require`/`revert`
issues.description: Avoid `require` / `revert` statements in a loop because a single bad item can cause the whole transaction to fail. It's better to forgive on fail and return failed elements post processing of the loop

issues.title: Dead Code
issues.description: Functions that are not used. Consider removing them.

issues.title: Costly operations inside loop
issues.description: Invoking `SSTORE` operations in loops may waste gas. Use a local variable to hold the loop computation result.

issues.title: Unused Import
issues.description: Redundant import statement. Consider removing it.

issues.title: State Variable Could Be Constant
issues.description: State variables that are not updated following deployment should be declared constant to save gas. Add the `constant` attribute to state variables that never change.

issues.title: State Change Without Event
issues.description: There are state variable changes in this function but no event is emitted. Consider emitting an event to enable offchain indexers to track the changes.

issues.title: State Variable Could Be Immutable
issues.description: State variables that are only changed in the constructor should be declared immutable to save gas. Add the `immutable` attribute to state variables that are only changed in the constructor

issues.title: Unchecked Return
issues.description: Function returns a value but it is ignored. Consider checking the return value.
